alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Geneva, south central Houston, northwestern Jackson, eastern Holmes and northeastern Washington Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 350 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hartford to near Taylor. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chipley, Graceville, Bonifay, Marianna, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Slocomb, Malvern, Rehobeth, Cottondale, Esto, Madrid, Campbellton, Noma, Black, Richter Crossroads, Kellys Crossroads, Garretts Crossroads and Tendil Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
